items.title: Indian Hotels Company: Healthy Q4FY25 results; strong growth prospects
items.description: IHCL, with its leadership position and a comprehensive portfolio, is well-positioned to gain from the industry upcycle.

items.title: Cummins India shares fall 5 percent after parent withdraws 2025 guidance over tariff turmoil
items.description: Citing 'growing economic uncertainty', Cummins Inc said it is not providing an outlook for revenue or profitability for the rest of 2025.

items.title: Buy Coforge; target of Rs 10,765: Choice Equity Broking
items.description: Choice Equity Broking is bullish on Coforge has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 10,765 in its research report dated May 06, 2025.

items.title: Buy Nuvoco Vistas Corp; target of Rs 441: Choice Equity Broking
items.description: Choice Equity Broking is bullish on Nuvoco Vistas Corp has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 441 in its research report dated May 05, 2025.

items.title: DCM Shriram extends gain to second day, jumps 11% on strong Q4 results
items.description: DCM Shriram shares have jumped 13 percent over the last 2 trading sessions, as against 0.6 percent rise in the Nifty 50 index

items.title: Utkarsh Small Finance Bank: Why this stock is for risk-takers?
items.description: Lower default, better recovery expected as micro-finance cycle turns around

items.title: Coforge shares rally 5% on strong Q4 show, brokerages see 47% upside
items.description: Brokerages are bullish on Coforge amid continued revenue growth momentum, supported by robust deal intake and pipeline, and strong execution.

items.title: Pharma shares sulk on Trump's plan to reduce reliance on foreign-made medicines
items.description: The USFDA is expected to submit a report within 180 days of the order, reviewing regulations and guidance on development of domestic pharma manufacturing. The Executive Order also proposes steps to eliminate ' duplicative or unnecessary requirements' in regulations.

items.title: Why this growth leader from Indian IT is a must add
items.description: Revenue traction, sequential margin improvement, and record order flows set the stage for earnings growth

items.title: CCL Products shares jump over 15% as net profit jumps by 54% YoY in Q4
items.description: CCL Products consolidated net profit for the fourth quarter rose by 56.35 percent to Rs 101.9 crore

items.title: Agri Picks Report May 06, 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, Sowing of summer crops across India progressed to 7.3 million hectares as of Friday, up 15% from 6.3 million hectares sown a year ago, according to data released by the agriculture ministry.

items.title: After Trafiksol, Wagons Learning withdraws IPO over 'prevailing market conditions'
items.description: This is the first SME IPO to be withdrawn after Trafiksol ITS Technologies whose public issue was launched in September last year

items.title: Indian Hotels shares slip over 3% as strong Q4 triggers profit-booking
items.description: IHCL board has suggested a dividend of Rs 2.25 per equity share, which will be confirmed in the upcoming annual general meeting

items.title: IRCON International shares up 2% on winning order worth Rs 187cr from Kerala State IT Infrastructure
items.description: IRCON International Share Price | The share touched a 52-week high of Rs 351.65 and a 52-week low of Rs 134.30 on 15 July, 2024 and 03 March, 2025, respectively.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: Nifty at 24,400, Sensex falls 190 pts; oil & gas, pharma, PSU Bank drag
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: Except auto, telecom, all other sectoral indices are trading in the red. M&M, Hero MotoCorp, Bharti Airtel, Eicher Motors, Bajaj Auto are among top gainers on the Nifty, while losers are Cipla, Adani Enterprises, Jio Financial, Shriram Finance, Adani Ports. BSE Midcap and Smallcap indices are down 0.5 percent each.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) extended buying on May 5 as they bought equities of Rs 497 crore ,while Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) also bought equities of Rs 2788 crore.

items.title: Stocks to Watch Today: Indian Hotels, CCL Products, DCM Shriram, Ather Energy, Senores Pharma, Paras Defence, Glenmark in focus on 6 May
items.description: Stocks to Watch, 06 May: Stocks like Computer Age Management Services, Bombay Dyeing & Manufacturing Company, Zee Media Corporation, Jammu & Kashmir Bank, Prataap Snacks, Hind Rectifiers, Cigniti Technologies, Coforge, Indian Energy Exchange, Paras Defence and Space Technologies, and IRCON International will be in focus on May 6.

items.title: Weak results triggered earnings downgrade on 35 out of 50 Nifty names: JM Financial
items.description: Over the last 12 months, the Nifty 50 index has gained around eight percent, but estimates for FY25-26E earnings per share (EPS) have been lower.

items.title: Midcap, smallcap indices drop 1.5% on broad-based selling: Here are the top losers
items.description: The broader market indices underperformed in comparison to the benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty.

items.title: Exide Industries in advanced talks with 2Ws, 3W player for battery manufacturing
items.description: Exide Industries also confirmed that it is supplying auxiliary batteries for E2W and E4W to auto OEMs. The company has been seeing a rising demand for advanced batteries, as faster urbanization powers vehicle demand.

items.title: Top gainers and losers today: Stocks that moved the most on May 6
items.description: The index opened flat and briefly touched a high of 24,509 before retreating to end the session rangebound amid muted activity. The BSE Mid and Smallcap indices fell sharply, shedding around 2%.

items.title: Taking Stock: Realty, PSU Banks drag Nifty below 24,400; Sensex down 156 pts
items.description: Except auto, all other sectoral indices ended in the red with PSU Bank index shedding nearly 5 percent, Realty index fell 3.5 percent, while pharma, consumer durables, media, oil & gas, power were down 1-2.6 percent.

items.title: Live: Nifty Drops Below 24,400 Amid Broad-Based Weakness| Banks, Realty Crack| Closing Bell
items.description: Nifty slips below 24,400 amid Broad-based weakness. Broader markets underperform; midcap index sheds 2%. Breadth weak; NSE advance-decline ratio at 1:5. PSU banking index sheds nearly 5%. Realty, oil & gas among other big losers. Auto only sector in green. Catch Nandita Khemka and Yatin Mota as they discuss stocks on their radar.
